thread.title: CBA Equities, Bell Potter go Platinum
thread.title_full: CBA Equities, Bell Potter go Platinum | afr.com

author: afr.com
title: CBA Equities, Bell Potter go Platinum
text:
Kerr Neilson's Platinum Asset Management is launching a new Asian-focused fund. Nic Walker by Sarah Thompson Anthony Macdonald Jake Mitchell Kerr Neilson's Platinum Asset Management has drafted in CBA Equities and Bell Potter as joint lead managers for its new Asian-focused listed investment company.
An announcement is expected on Wednesday, after Street Talk Online revealed Bell Potter's involvement.
Platinum Asia Investments is seeking to raise at least $150 million. The LIC will focus on long-term capital growth through investing primarily in undervalued listed securities in Asia, excluding Japan.
Street Talk revealed Ellerston Capital was also considering launching an Asian LIC.
Elsewhere, UBS analysts have valued ASX aspirant Redcape Group's equity at $460 million to $545 million, which implied a multiple of 13.3 to 15.8 times forecast profit.
Pre-marketing research sent to fund managers said the valuation implied a dividend yield of 5.7 per cent to 7 per cent.
The valuation is lower than fellow Redcape joint lead manager JPMorgan's estimates. The US bank's analysts said Redcape's equity was worth $532 million to $604 million, or 15.4 to 17.5 times forecast fiscal 2016 earnings, as revealed by Street Talk.
Redcape owns hotel operations and freehold real estate for 24 hotels, as well as leaseholds for two hotels, across NSW and Queensland.
